column11: Review Text
Nothing exceptional these beaches. Not necessarily very clean with restaurants and hard music the beach ... so not great.

What a fantastic place! We had a spacious room ground floor (4 rooms are connected with 2 on ground floor and 2 on 1st floor) and these are on a beautiful avenue. Cleaning twice a day. Swimming pool is top notch, but a dip in the ocean is definitely also recommended. Breakfast in large room is fine. Dinner we did 1x on the beach at the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We also started to walk on the left side of the beach and then after more than fifteen minutes you arrive at some very nice beach bars. Highly recommended to eat there.

Located in Trincomalee the eastern side of the country.... this beach is stunning! Lots of white sandy beach... and plenty space to chill, sun bath, grab a drink or even swim! The beach bar is pretty amazing as well!

column8: Immense beach in eastern Sri Lanka
column11: Visited during the dry season of this area of Sri Lanka, I found a perfect climate and not excessively warm. The beach is a few kilometers long, and is better equipped than the nearby Nilaveli. There are several proposals for water sports and diving. There are also places to stop for a snack or a cocktail in the evening. It is frequented by both tourists and people of Trincomalee, so very lively, but still it is so vast that you can find peace if you just want a little relaxation. The sea is not crystal clear but still clean and not excessively dangerous due to currents and waves. Recommended for a few days at sea after a tour in Sri Lanka.

column6: kandy tuk tuk tours by munasingha
column8: Uppuveli is close to Pigeon Island, a well-known spot for snorkeling and diving. The coral reefs are home to a variety o
column11: Uppuveli Beach is known for its pristine beauty, offering long stretches of soft white sand and clear blue waters. The beach is spacious, making it perfect for long walks, relaxing under palm trees

Only stayed in 5‚òÜ hotels whilst in Sri Lanka - this claims to be one, it isnt. No gym, no spa, no laundry, no bar after 10 pm. It does however have 5‚òÜ prices - 600 lkr for a coke from room, all other hotels have offered free drinks. The rooms arent finished and next door to me there were builders working. On leaving l was charged the same room rate as a couple and l am a single occupant. Totally unfair and a rip off! Dont stay here unless you have money to burn!

We reached the beach because we wanted to do some sea and we were told that it was the only non-monsoon area in July, the disappointment was huge, the beach is long but do not expect crystal clear blue sea; the color is gray with a very rough sand bottom and long waves, it is nothing special as well as the nearby Nivaneli, they have excessive costs for rooms and restaurants but remain undeveloped tourist centers, dilapidated and dirty villages. The only pretty beach with crystal clear blue sea we saw was under the temple of Trincomalee.

If the below stated is something for you during your stay, then Uppuveli is definitely something for you: - Significant amount of garbage on the beach. - Cows and a lot of street dogs on the beach. - Crows ‚Äúsinging‚Äù from early in the morning. - Call for morning prayer starts at 04:30 and continue during the day and evening.

The sea is clean enough, but the beach is dirty. Plastic everywhere. Only sections in front of hotels or restaurants are cleaned. A little further plastic everywhere. The restaurants are nice, especially in the evening, but the prices are crazy. For a dinner you pay almost as much as in Europe and at least double or triple what you pay in other non-sea parts of Sri Lanka. Prices for tourists.

I recently stayed in Nilaveli , thankfully. After taking a day trip to Upeveli ,I just couldn't believe what I saw. Piles of rubbish littered the roads, laneways and beaches. Something needs to be done on a grander scale here. Government and tourism boards need to wake up and so do us tourists. This issue needs to be dealt with

Nice beach with palm trees but unfortunately the topic of environmental protection is not yet adopted here. The beach is littered with plastic - even on the meadows under the palm trees you will find a lot of garbage, plastic bottles and cans. Too bad- should not be more!!!
Wonderful tropical experience. Delectable food and drinks! Beachfront views, soul touching music and most friendly staff. winner!

Really disappointing beach. It's sad that it's so mistreated with trash washing yp on shore and gathering on the beach. What would otherwise be a very scenic and pleasant environment is totally spoiled. Small portions may be well maintained ed by individual resorts or bars .... intermittently. Overall, it's hard to enjoy swimming, sitting, or walking with so much rubbish.
Lovely place to visit. In October very quiet beach. Lots of place closed but still some great places for eating.  Beach was clean and sea was stunningly warm.

The beach is very large and clean. If you go to Trincomalee this is the best beach. There are very nice beach restaurants. If you need to reach it, take the Fernando restaurant as a reference. There are various accommodations also directly on the beach Even in the internal streets there are many restaurants and accommodation

Despite having lower reviews than nearby Nilaveli, it wins hands down. Many photos are obsolete, we didn't find all that dirt at all, the sea is the same as Nilaveli but we didn't find any annoying jellyfish and it is also much better equipped, both with structures and rooms. Don't imagine the beaches full of Italian-style umbrellas anyway, we're talking about a couple of restaurants that also have sunbeds, but it's absolutely worth it, both for the low costs and for the beautiful passage
Uppuveli is a very nice beach on the east coast of Sri Lanka. Clams seas and beautiful colors of the beach and sea are the main things about Uppuveli beach.

We visited here in the low season, so perhaps this impacted our experience, but we found this beach covered in litter.  Like many Sri Lankan beaches, it has been spoiled by humans. A very sad sight indeed.
wonderful beach that you can walk around 2 to 3 KM without any obstacles , beach is clean and beautiful
The Uppuveli Beaches are stunning. Really wide, blue waters and calm during the season, April through August
This beach is one of my favorite spots on the Sri Lankan coast line. A quite little spot makes you feel like you have the whole place to yourself.

such a beautiful beach, so wide, fine sand so comfortable to walk Bearfoot. The sea is calm as ever in the months of April to October as it is the peak of the season. I visited in July and so calm and nice. Such a shame due to COVID 19 the beach is empty, other than the occasional pulling of the Fishing nets, which is a silent action and does not disturb anyone. also, it is an attraction to the visitors. There are plenty of restaurants, and however, it is limited due to COVID , if not even Coconut Palm Lodge operates a beautiful restaurant which is a 24-hour operation. Owners have not reduced any prices in their menus at present and they may do it soon t recover their losses rather staying with their high rate of food.
Wonderful sea and sand. One of the best beaches in Sri Lanka. Sea is like a pool and really warm water.

Uppuveli is a lovely long beach, great for swimming (though you need to hike out a fair while before it starts getting deep).  I managed to go for a few morning runs, and 5km on the sand was no problem with nothing interfering.  It's a working beach with fishermen all along the way, which I find fascinating to watch. However, it is quite dirty with lots of plastic and rubbish.  And the many crows and dogs (only once did I get chased, so I suppose that's a good effort by the strays).  Definitely worth a visit if you are on the East Coast.

We were staying at Trinco Blu and the beach there was kept beautifully. There was no rubbish and the beach was raked daily. The further down the beach you go towards Trincomelee the dirtier it gets. There is rubbish everywhere. In mitigation we were there at the end of the low season so it might get better. The Authorities really need to get to grips with the problem. We walked from Trinco Blu down the beach to Trincomalee and it really is interesting especially the fishing villages, but again the rubbish spolis it.

I stayed there 4 days it's a good place for peaceful people so quite best place on beach is Fernando's bar Very stylish. Moreover can visit koneswarm temple, fort Fredrick and naval museum. Fish market also interesting for sea food lovers.

The first view of the beach is nice, however very quickly, plastic waste starts to appear. Then the sights are a shame: the locals throw their garbage bags directly in the sea, a huge disgusting waste water stream goes in the ocean, a construction site right on the shore where workers through all kind of stuff from there. Rubbish absolutely everywhere. At one point, it was so bad that we had to put our shoes because we felt so unsafe of what we could step on. The fishermen coming back from fishing throw the red plastic bags on the beach and in the sea. Don't even try to go to Fort Frederick from the beach, my boyfriend and I did and after the curve at the "second part" of the beach, we didn't feel safe at all. The government or anyone has to do something ASAP.

This is a beautiful beach. The beach is dirty and full of plastics. The danger is it's full of stray Dogs. They are all over and coming behind you  you have to chase them all the time,not sure they have rabies.

We loved our 3 days here! The beach is beautiful fine, white sand and the water so calm and clear. We enjoyed not seeing too many tourists at Esha Beach Resort and also felt as though we were in amongst the locals, which was pretty cool!
Beautiful Beach area with good views. You can see fisherman, fishing boats in this area. Also you can have a sea bath
The place is really nice, sadly ruined by stupid locals polluting the area with trash and plastic bags, fishermens and people living there they don't care absolutely nothing of sea and nature

This beach is beautiful.  Soft golden sand and (when we visited) benign waves.  The beach is not empty but nor is it too busy.  The location of beach cafes and so forth, and the home of diving organisations. Fishing activities provided added interest.
Ideal for relaxing. Trips to Pigeon Island, whale watching and diving possibilities. lovely restaurants. Just loved it.

This is an interesting beach to walk and watch the fisherman - watching the nets being pulled in was great but yes the rubbish is appalling even on more isolated beaches further north  there was phenomenal amounts of plastic etc..Good for swimming but there was rubbish in the water. v sad that there doesn't appear to be any moves to deal with this problem.

Travelled all over Sri Lanka but really sad when I came here to see the amount of plastic rubbish here. The 3 of us spent the 2 hours in the sea dragging as much plastic out as we could onto the sand in the hope that Fernando beach bar would dispose of it. Then saw the fisherman drag in their nets which was swamped with plastic but instead of hauling onto the beach they just picked it off and threw it back inthe sea.üò°üò°üò•
This beach provides a fairly safe beach and surf to spend a quiet day in the hot sun.   Need to organise transport to get to the beach

We were excited to come to Uppuveli which is recommended by several tourist guides (such as Lonely Planet) as beautiful beach with less crowds. The reality is rubbish, plastic, dead fish and weird dogs all over the beach except for some little spaces in front of the hotels. It is very sad to see how the fishermen and people treat their own beach and the nature. We walked all the way down to Lovers Leap and from mile to mile it was even worse. I would definitely not recommend coming here and it was not worth to take the long journey from Sigiriya. We really hope that the South will be better.

The sand is lovely and the sea slopes gently so swimming is possible when not too rough. About half the beach is devoted to fishing boats and there are few hotels and bars. The high water mark is covered in plastic bottles and debris from the sea and only cleaned up in front of a couple of up-market hotels. I though the row of beachside bars and chalets at the north end fairly grotty though others may find them pleasantly rustic.

I read about the place many positive opinions. Unfortunately, the beach disappoints in real. I was here during January and it is out of season here. The weather was exceptional, very sunny and hot. But it does not help.
Nice beach in East cost srilanka. Sea was somewhat rough because of the wind. During low season it was very nice to enjoy in beach with sunbathing.
A long wonderful beach with soft sand. Safe and extremely enjoyable for long walks or a swim in the warm ocean.

Nice sandy beach, need to go a long way out to get out of your depth. Good swimming. Waves quite small.  water warm. Lots of accomodation opens onto beach with hotel beach bars. Excellent beach cafe in middle. Lots of young people there. 2 sets of lifeguards. Busy.

Great sand, great water and quite clean. The restaurants and bars down to the beach are plenty and the food and prices are pretty much good/fine. BUT you have to careful when the locals speed up their tourist boats onto the beach. But otherwise a really great beach - not too busy and not too remote and isolated.
I am sure this should be one of the longest beaches in Trinco, Very quiet, long and a lot of restaurants with cabana's. A must try beach if you are in trinco area
Uppuveli in septembre was a tranquil place to be. The beach is very nice. The restaurants in Allas Garden are very good and give tasty food.

I visited this beach in September 2018 and it was very clean, I walked all the way and did not see the dirt shown in some of the pictures. yes there are many fishing boats and tours boats but the beach is clean and beautiful. am sure they clean it always.

lots of chilled out places for eats drinks and loud music. Luxury hotels at far end away from the party scene,-Lots of polysterene washing up on the tide. long beach which one day will be discovered by mass tourism. No hassle and friendly folk.

This is quite a clean beach and the waves are not too strong. Would recommend catching the sunrise and enjoying the ocean when it is very calm early in the morning. Walked a great length of the beach and it was a good mix of restaurants/resorts and natural beach. Many people swimming throughout the day but did not see any lifeguards.

We stopped at the southern end of Uppuveli, and to be brutally honest it‚Äôs not that great, Trincomalee looks a tired place, probably the most uninviting city we‚Äôve been to. The beach at Uppuveli reflects this and it‚Äôs one to miss for us. Nilaveli as a area looked a lot better when I passed through it, so maybe the beach here would be a better option but from what I saw of the southern end of Uppuveli it was almost in a industrial come battered setting.

We totally enjoyed our stay on Uppeveli beach. None of us wanted to leave! The beach is beautiful and very clean, the people welcoming and the restaurants offer great Sri Lankan food. However, please be aware of the jelly fish. My daughter and I were stung by very small ones which made it just a bit painful but there were many big ones to take care of. Don't leave your children alone there without watching out for these!! This is the only reason why I didn't give it's otherwise well deserved full marks! Definitely worth spending a few nights!

This is a wide, long, beautiful beach with soft white sand and clear waters. Much less developed than the beaches on the south coast, there are a few beach restaurants & multiple rice & curry and fish restaurants on the road leading to the beach. Peak season to visit is July - mid September. There are a handful of mid sized hotels but the majority of accommodation nearby is small independents and guest houses.
Very touristic, all bars and restaurants are overpriced and very closely placed. The beach itself is nice but lots of boats and hotels

Nice beach, clean and not too touristy. I found it was good place to stop for for a couple nights. The bars with the sun loungers and huts let you use them no problem. There are a few roaming cows and dogs but they weren‚Äôt a nuisance for me. A couple of places sell alcoholic cocktails.

We came here for the beach and were not dissapointed! We went for Uppuveli over Nilaveli as were worried Nilaveli may be a bit too quiet, and we made the right choice. Plenty of bars and restaurants in Up but didn't feel too busy. Had a nice chilled out vibe, friendly people and very safe. Although watch out for the bulls that roam the beach and like to attack the people! That was actually a little dangerous!

Loved the beach here the water is clear and emerald.If you walk at first light you can watch the fishermen unloading their catch. It‚Äôs nice and cool before the suns out. There are lots of nice places to eat and it‚Äôs easy to get a tuktuk to Trincomalee . We liked it better than Nilivelli.

Please be aware of the aggressive stray dogs between Uppuveli beach and Trincomalee beach. Me and my fianc√© went for a walk near the fishing boats when 2 dogs started chasing us, barking and growling. The only way we could get away was to get into the water about waist height. I have seen other reviews with very similar scenarios. Please take care.

Stopped in to Uppervalli for 2 and a half days and had a fun time. A relaxed atmosphere and no pressure from outlets, there is plenty of accomodation and food options centered around a nice beach. Was a little quiet but suited us, this place has a good mix of locals and tourists mainly from Europe. Went Whale watching, snorkeling and generally, swam, ate, drank, volleyball and soaked up the beach music around Fernandos and the surrounding restaurants. Good vibe beach side for a couple of days and than moved on.
Peaceful beach for relax full day in a holiday. Many guest houses available near the beach. Like this beach much.
Nice beach in east cost for relaxing. Prrfect area for snorkelling whale watching and scuba diving. No much local crowd
Nice beach. A few restaurants. Sunchairs avaliable. No need to buy stuff to use sunchairs. Very few people trying to sell you things. Not crowded.

This beach has everything you could expect of a tropical beach. The water has just the right temperature and the beach is ringed by majestic palm trees. There is even a great bar and a funky beach bucket shower. As the beach is ringed by great places to eat you will love it.

Off the beaten track a little but easy access to Tricomalee, this is a long sweeping palm fringed beach. Sunsets,  sand and swim in relative peace. Restaurants and beach activities about aid your relax. Time
Very nice beach and very calm for families with small children.  Not crowded at all.  Good diving opportunities very close to this beach
A lovely working beach with very friendly fisherman who work very hard around tourists. Many hotels and guest houses here some with direct access to the beach.

We stayed not to far from the beach. It was actually very nice & clean beach, no rubbish etc....some good beach bars/restaurants on the beach on down the nearby laneways. Would recommend staying nearby. Ideal to swim etc.... highly recommended
Lovely beach and the water seems to be very clean - haven‚Äôt seen any plastic rubbish floating about. Good restaurants all within a minutes walk of the beach. Friendly doggo‚Äôs too!

Uppuveli is a great location far enough from the town to feel secluded yet near enough to go into town for shopping. The beach is stunning and not spoilt by being over comercialised  "yet"   It is a really nice walk along the beach where you can watch the fishermen bring in the nets and sort the catch. Walk to the lagoon at the north end and wade accross the river to visit the temple, the trees here are full of beautiful birds, different varieties of Kingfisher, and sea eagles soar here too. The fishing boats leave here on the incoming tide each day.

Not like most of other beaches. Bsach is clean and less crowd. I was here in low season. So there were no more Diving centers and snorkeling tours. But it was wonderful in relaxing. No disturbance from sellers like other beaches. Love this beach.
Empty beaches and little hotels make this a nice place to relax and stay. Clear water and rest is what you will find

uppuweli is very nice beach to do bathing, swiming. they are no very crowd, i think uppuweli is not famous than nilaveli, but i think uppuweli is better than nilaweli beach..  they are in frindly forgines. Beach is safe. if u think swiming and relaxing with your friends. this is the most suitable place in the trincomalee.  and i recomend evening is better than mid day.. after 4 pm

Perfect beach to relaxing, swimming and enjoy alone or with your loved once. No need to worry about the safe, there are no dangerous waves or sharks. Life guards do their duty well. I think it is most beautiful with the sun shining.

Febrauray is really not the time to visit the east coast. The sea was rough. The beach itself was pretty clean and is a long stretch. May be due to of season did not see many restaurants open at the beach

The beach is stunning, and the area has loads of cafes and restaurants to eat at, as well as plenty of places to stay. The atmosphere is very chilled, and you can get a tuk tuk into Trincomalee in about 15 minutes.

I dont t really understand these positive comments about this beach. we've chosen to come here for swimming after readimg the comments but our experience is absolutely negative so that we have decided to leave. you'll see trash almost everywhere on the beach. plastic bottle, fuel container, broken glass, cans, dead fish, dead birds,etc. but the bigger problem is the aggressive stray dogs which are really dangerous. I was almost bitten today. I had to run into water to escape. this beach is definitely not worth 5 stars. please be honest in writing your comments.
this is an ideal spot for a quiet relaxation, and a swim in the tropical blue waters.   Gets very hot during midday.  Check the ideal months to visit the beach

This was a very memorable trip! We stayed at the Amanthare Bay in Uppuvelli in Trincomalee! It was a great stay and we got to enjoy the many incredible and interesting sites during our stay such as Dolphin watching, Hot Springs , Koneswaram Temple and the beautiful view it offers!

This place is fantastic. A calm, quiet beach with good choices of hotels and restaurants and not at all built up or spoiled by development. It is on the east coast so the best season to go is April to October which is low season for the European tourists so the town has not really developed. Also it suffered from the 2004 Tsunami and the civil war. In high season the NW monsoon hits so the sea is rough and everybody heads for the west coast resorts. If you are in Sri Lanka at the right time of year then you will not be disappointed by a few nights in Uppuveli

Here is an honest review. Maybe I'm spoilt coming from Australia, but I've travelled a bit and can honestly say this rates in the bottom of the list for beaches I've enjoyed swimming at. The sand has a horrible blackness inside it spoiling its attempt at white colour. There is a polluted river washing in from its northern end and nearly all "storm water" from the city runs directly into the beach at regular intervals. It is populated with incredibly overpriced dining options, and touts wanting you to take a diving trip with them. We saw a dead dog not 100metres from the most expensive resort in the area. All in all, the lack of a single international hotel chain should be enough of a red flag to anyone, but hopefully this review helps against the tide of goodwill others have provided and which made us come here.

Golden sand, palm trees, large breaking waves, local fishing boats (and fish), boat-trips to see dolphins - and blue whales in season - scuba and snorkelling trips, banana boat etc ...  This beach has everything, though food is probably cheaper in the small lanes which lead to the beach. Lots to do and see - or just relax.  And nearby Trincomalee is also interesting.
Fantastic beach. In my opinion is the best beach in Trincomalee. It has deserted areas, Hindu temples, fishing areas. It is worth strolling along the beach.
Many fishing boats can see. Great place to relax. Lovely beach with lot space. Also nice place to have a boat ride
Great spot after a long ride, lovely beach but bloody hot! Great place for relaxation, food and drinks.

My Cab driver went on telling me the private beach of the hotel where i stayed is also Uppuveli but the actual beach spot of uppuveli is real good for long walk and the water colour and tides are different from Marble beach

We were supposed to stay in uppuveli 2 nights but we book one more. The beach is huge and you have lots of space to relax. It is a nice place to relax and take a break. We stayed at trinco blu hotel, nice beach bungalow and you also have good restaurants around where you can eat fresh sea food. The only sad thing is that the beach is just cleaned in front of the restaurants and hotels, maybe the Sri Lanka government such put more an effort on cleaning not just the beaches but The country it self, but anyway I still recommend it :)

Took a tuk tuk here from Trinco as heard great things about the beach and beach area.  It was a lovely beach in parts however we walked back to Trinco along the beach and the middle section wasn't good.  I suspect it's generally not visited by tourists as there are no facilities, attractions or restaurants, it appears to be more residential.  Litter is a significant problem in this stretch of the beach
Most of the famous beaches in trinco are over crowded and you won't feel comfortable if u are visiting with family. But Uppuveli is still offering that privacy and comfort.

I am amazed at the reviews for this beach!. I stayed at the Trinco Blu for 4 nights in February . The Trinco Blu looks after the beach right outside its property very well but just look to your left and right and it's a very different story. Bottles, cans, cartons, straws, plastic bags, dead chickens, burger containers - I could go on and on. It's utterly disgusting. These things also find their way into the sea, and after a while I decided not to swim in it, it was far too dirty. I observed the fishermen throw all their rubbish on the sand and discard dead puffer fish by just leaving them on the sea edge for someone to tread on. The sea is their rubbish bin. They wait for the tide to take it out but their nets were full of trash as well as fish. They literally are catching their own rubbish. I also saw tourists who should know better leave their empty cigarette packets and water bottles on the beach. Open your eyes to how things really are, not how you want to see them. Our oceans and world should be treated with more respect and as tourists we have the power to change things by refusing to pretend it's not there.

Lovely clean beach backed with palm trees with enough shacks to keep you supplied with food and beer .. The beach is gently sloping so you can walk out into the sea a long way before it gets deep  and i detected no strong currents so it appears about as safe as you can get .
An amazing laid back beach, perfect for long afternoon walks, relaxation and swimming. The best part is in Alles Garden, on the northern end.
One of the best beaches in Sri Lanka. Sandy golden beach. But due to recent influx of tourist there are bags, plastics cans here and there. Overall great for sunbatch.
this beach is a bit off the main road... and is well maintained and clean.. the JKAB resort and a few moe are located here and excellent view

A Paradise for swimming - snorkeling - diving - or simply chilling on the beach BYOB - there are many guesthouse ranging from budget to ultra-expensive - very few places to eat outside the resorts where food is overpriced - it is only 6 km - 200 ruppees Tuk-Tuk ride - We prefer Trinco Town - Still Great easy day trip
nice beach nice people all are in one place not like nilaveli there are nothing to do boring, have beach parties

We visited Uppuveli in the low season and still couldn¬¥t quite figure out why people don¬¥t visit this place in this time of the year. It¬¥s still some beach tirsty tourist strolling around and blending in with local fishermen pulling their nets on to the beach in the afternoon. The beach is vast and deep with a lot of space and around the restaurants and resorts they clean the beach every day (you can still find patches in between with some garbage that floated ashore). The beach meet some swell in the middle but are more calm in the north and the south side. You¬¥ll might struggle with finding a good place to eat but there is a good and fairly priced restaurant called the Crab on the beach¬¥s north end that hold local food to a high standard, check it out! If you like to go for a little adventere you can wade over the stream where the lagoon meets the ocean and find a private little beach and much more =)

Great golden sand beach in a beautiful environment. Good backpacker atmosphere. There are a few not so well priced restaurants but with great food. At nights, fresh fish is cooked on grills. We had a lovely three day break from seeing temple after temple. I expect that in a couple of years, it won't be as authentic as it is now, so enjoy it while it lasts! Fishermen can be seen bringing their nets in full of fish. Amazing experience!

A lovely beach made of soft white sand. Still genuine, fishermen working on the beach, not too much tourist, even if a huge part of the beach is surrounded by hotels and guesthouse. Such as other places in Sri Lanka, it smells sometimes the benzine, and some restaurants/places such as Fernando's bar are transformed to loud and noisy disco bar as from 7PM, with a boring beat sound and flashing multicolour lights polluting the whole beach and any stars watching moment you would like to be romantic. So this is definitely a place to discover as it is still authentic, but let's hope that development of tourism will go in a positive direction

Stayed right on the beach (a range of hostelries on the beach here). Sand is soft. Beach is clean. A few water sport places (shake watching, scuba diving etc) too. Twice a day watch the fishermen haul in their nets and sell their catch on the beach to local restaurants and hotels. Came here in August and the sea was clear and calm enough for swimming (but be prepared to do a bit of wave jumping!) Currently this place is very under developed. No high rise hotels, chain hotels or rowdy bars.
